result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. JON J. BUDSBERG

Defendant JON J. BUDSBERG in court.  Attorney Nicole A Morley in court for JON J. BUDSBERG.  Prosecuting attorney Tucker T. Tellefson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant in SOAR. Request for 90 day adjournment.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Absolute sobriety.  No possession or consumption of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. COMPLY WITH THE CONDITIONS OF THE DRUG FREE 24/7 PROGRAM.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 29, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

01:38 PM Defendant JON J. BUDSBERG in court with attorney Nicole A Morley.  Christian A. Gossett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State's offer - SORE Program.  Bond continues.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Status conference on June 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

09:12 AM Defendant JON J. BUDSBERG in court with attorney Nicole A Morley.  Tracy Ann Paider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests additional time - no objections - court grants.  Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on May 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defense acknowledges receipt of information and waives reading.  Noting a special appearance and enters a not guilty plea.  Court notes victim's rights are complied with.  Court orders bond to continue.  Status conference scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.

The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.  Bond Continues.  Record closed @ 9:16.  Arraignment scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
